title: Why is there no crit CHANCE cap?
body: Like it really doesnt make sense why you can build 100% crit CHANCE. It's not a CHANCE anymore. It's guaranteed double damage or guaranteed 225% damage because {{item:3031}}. Once an adc completes a build with 100%crit you literally cant even get close to them. They will oneshot you.

replies.body:
Maybe thats the reason they're called ADCs...
And having 100% Crit chance means you have 4 crit items and usually you build boots before fullbuild. So yeah, they have dmg, but no resists, hp, lifesteal. Take basically any assassin and unless its Trist that kills you before you get into your spells range you're ok.
The only problem with crit is yas that doesnt need to waste 2 item slots with crit items and rather builds BT, mallet or sterak so he does more dmg and is also tanky.
It requires 4 items to get there. Meanwhile other champions can oneshot at 0 items.

Behold for the savior has arrived

{{item:3143}}
Ah yes, after that item it gets reduced to guaranteed 180% damage. Problem solved.
It adds up really fast especially considering the armor it adds as well.

I mean it doesnt seem like a lot, and I was looking at probuilds for xayah(common 100% crit champ) and looked at what the enemy team built against a fed xayah and literally no high elo players, not even hard tanks like sej build randuins. Thornmail seems to be the go to item.

I feel like either the community has forgotten about randuins purpose or some pro coach calculated that randuins is not efficient compared to thornmail and that has trickled down into soloq meta.

Well I suppose it depends on the other members of Xayah's team. Did her team have a Warwick and an Illaoi? Because in that situation Thornmail probably would have been better. For me Randuin's is usually the go-to item if the enemy team has Yasuo, Tryndamere, or Ashe as it tends to have the biggest impact on them. Well, that's what I do if the rest of their team's carrying potential doesn't have any form of healing.

> [{quoted}](name=BlackKnightJack,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=0lVA1enW,comment-id=00010000000000000000,timestamp=2019-08-28T06:58:50.585+0000)
>
> Well I suppose it depends on the other members of Xayah's team. Did her team have a Warwick and an Illaoi? Because in that situation Thornmail probably would have been better. For me Randuin's is usually the go-to item if the enemy team has Yasuo, Tryndamere, or Ashe as it tends to have the biggest impact on them. Well, that's what I do if the rest of their team's carrying potential doesn't have any form of healing.

Even then, Yasuo and Tryndamere build with Conqueror and all 3 of them can and most likely will build BT/BotRK and LW against Randuin's, which will make them pretty hard to kill unless they are chain cc'd or way behind. Meanwhile Thornmail will cockblock them harder.

I mean, that's a justification for buying it if they have other team members with inherent sustain or build sustain with no crit, but otherwise Randuin's is better. After all, what you described is lifesteal and lifesteal does less if they're doing less damage to you anyway.
Not even slightly true, but sure.

It's because crit champions sacrifice reliable damage until they reach that point(or Infinity Edge at least). If an ADC hits 100% crit chance, they're at the stage of the game where they're meant to kick your trachea down and out of your poop hole.

There should be a soft cap and diminishing returns on Crit and LifeSteal/SpellVamp

Cap should be 40% on LS/SV and 70% on Crit with Crit champ caping at 80%
